member.param: The file to get text from

member.name: M:MAT.TextFileCommands.ConvertFileEncoding(System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Converts a file from its current encoding to another encoding to another.
member.example:
Convert the file to unicode if it is not already
TextFileCommands.ConvertFileEncoding("C:\\test.txt", "C:\\test.txt", System.Text.Encoding.UTF8);

Convert all the files in a folder to Unicode
TextFileCommands.ConvertFileEncoding("C:\\source\\", "C:\\dest\\", System.Text.Encoding.UTF8);
member.param: Encoding to which the contents should be converted

member.name: M:MAT.TextFileCommands.DetermineEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the encoding type of a file if it exists.
member.returns: Encoding determined from preamble or default

member.name: M:MAT.TextFileCommands.GetItemList(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a plain text file one line at a time adding each line to a string array.

member.name: M:MAT.TextFileCommands.GetXmlString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query. Search help for Introduction to the Syntax of XPath
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Reads value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
string result = TextFileCommands.GetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value");
Read value for data
string result = TextFileCommands.GetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data");

member.name: M:MAT.TextFileCommands.GetXmlString(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query. Introduction to the Syntax of XPath
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Reads value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
string result = TextFileCommands.GetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value");
Read value for data
string result = TextFileCommands.GetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data");
member.param: Decode XML information; default is true

member.name: M:MAT.TextFileCommands.SetXmlString(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes data to the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query. Introduction to the Syntax of XPath
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Write new data to the value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
TextFileCommands.SetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value", "false");
Write a new value for data
TextFileCommands.GetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data", "New content.");
member.remarks: Make sure that & is written as &
member.param: Content to place in the node replacing existing content

member.name: M:MAT.TextFileCommands.SetXmlString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes data to the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query.
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Write new data to the value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
TextFileCommands.SetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value", "false");
Write a new value for data
TextFileCommands.GetXmlString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data", "New content.");
member.remarks: Make sure that & is written as &
member.param: Content to place in the node replacing existing content
Encode XML information; default is true

member.name: T:MAT.Data.RandomString
member.summary: RandomString is a class designed for creating quick random strings.

example.code: RandomData rnd = RandomData.GetInstance();
string rndString = rnd.String.Next(); //printable characters, length 256

RandomString rs = rnd.String; string str = rs.Next(); //printable characters, length 256 str = rs.Next(StringType.LowerCase | StringType.Numeric, 50); //50 lowercase or numeric chars str = rs.Next(StringType.Printable, 12, true); //12 alphanumeric characters, trimmed (not beginning or ending in whitespace)
string email = rs.NextEmail(15); //random email with *@*.* format, where * is one or more characters
string greek = rs.Next(StringType.Greek);

member.name: T:MAT.ZipArchive
member.summary:
ZipArchive represents a Zip Archive. It uses the System.IO.File structure as its guide
The largest structual difference between a ZipArchive and the textStream system is that the archive has no independent notion of a 'directory'. Instead files know their complete path name. For the most part this difference is hard to notice, but does have some ramifications. For example there is no concept of the modification time for a directory.
TODO: Opening a textStream for Read/Write without truncation. TODO: Allowing different text encodings (is it worth it since they could do it themselves.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Openes an existing ZIP archive 'archivePath' for reading.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary:
Opens a ZIP archive, 'archivePath' If 'access' is ReadWrite or Write then the target does not need to exist, but will be created with the ZipArchive is closed.
If 'access' is ReadWrite the target can exist, and that data is used to initially populate the archive. Any modifications that were made will be updated when the Close() method is called (and not before).
If 'access' is Write then the target is either created or truncated to 0 before the archive is written (thus the original data in the archiveFile is ignored).

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Read an archive from an exiting stream or write a new archive into a stream

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.GetFilesInDirectory(System.String,System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns a subset of the files in the archive that are in the directory 'archivePath'. If searchOptions is TopDirectoryOnly only files in the directory 'archivePath' are returns. If searchOptions is AllDirectories then all files that are in subdiretories are also returned.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.OpenRead(System.String)
member.summary: Open the archive textStream 'archivePath' for reading and returns the resulting Stream. KeyNotFoundException is thrown if 'archivePath' does not exist

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the archive textStream 'archivePath' for writing and returns the resulting Stream. If the textStream already exists, it is truncated to be an empty textStream.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.Close
member.summary: Closes the archive. Until this call is made any pending modifications to the archive are NOT made (the archive is unchanged).

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.Clear
member.summary: Remove all files from the archive.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if 'archivePath' exists in the archive.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.Move(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renames sourceArchivePath to destinationArchivePath. If destinationArchivePath exists it is discarded.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Delete 'archivePath'. It returns true if successful. If archivePath does not exist, it simply returns false (no exception is thrown). The delete succeeds even if streams on the data exists (they continue to exist, but will not be persisted on Close()

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.CopyToFile(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.CopyFromFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copyies 'sourceFilePath from the textStream system to the archive as 'targetArchivePath' It will overwrite any existing textStream.

member.name: M:MAT.ZipArchive.DeleteDirectory(System.String)

member.name: M:MAT.NativeMethods.SetDllDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: The SetDllDirectory function modifies the search path used to locate DLLs for the application.
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the directory to be added. If this parameter is NULL, the default search path is used.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is true.
If the function fails, the return value is false. To get extended error information, call .

remarks.para: The SetDllDirectory function affects all subsequent calls to the and LoadLibraryEx functions. After calling SetDllDirectory, the DLL search path is:

item.description: The directory from which the application loaded.
The directory specified by the pathName parameter.
The system directory. Use the GetSystemDirectory function to get the path of this directory. The name of this directory is System32.
The 16-bit system directory. There is no function that obtains the path of this directory, but it is searched. The name of this directory is System.
The Windows directory. Use the GetWindowsDirectory function to get the path of this directory.
The directories that are listed in the PATH environment variable.

remarks.para: To revert to the default search path used by and LoadLibraryEx, call SetDllDirectory with NULL.

member.name: M:MAT.NativeMethods.GetDllDirectory(System.Int32,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: The GetDllDirectory function retrieves the application-specific portion of the search path used to locate DLLs for the application.
member.param: Size of the output buffer, in characters.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the application-specific portion of the search path.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is the length of the string copied to buffer, in characters, not including the terminating null character. If the return value is greater than bufferLength, it specifies the size of the buffer required for the path.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call .

member.name: T:MAT.BuildTasks.Remote

member.name: T:MAT.BuildTasks.SetBuildNumber
member.summary: Updates the assembly info AssemblyVersion and FileVersion.

example.code:
<UsingTask TaskName="MAT.BuildTasks.SetBuildNumber" AssemblyFile="MAT.Core.dll" /> <Target Name="BuildNumberOverrideTarget" Condition="$(IsDesktopBuild)!='true' and $(MachineName)!='CITFSBLD01'" DependsOnTargets ="InitializeWorkspace;"> <Exec Command="$(TFCommand) get /force $(AssemblyQuoted)" WorkingDirectory="$(BuildDirectory)" IgnoreExitCode="true"/>
<Exec WorkingDirectory="$(SolutionRoot)" Command="$(TFCommand) checkout $(AssemblyQuoted)" IgnoreExitCode="true"/>
<SetBuildNumber AssemblyInfoPath="$(AssemblyInfoFile)" BuildName="$(BuildPrefix)"> <Output TaskParameter="BuildNumber" PropertyName="BuildNumber"/> <Output TaskParameter="BuildNumberRoot" PropertyName="BuildNumberRoot"/> </SetBuildNumber>
<Exec WorkingDirectory="$(SolutionRoot)" Command="$(TFCommand) checkin /comment:$(NoCICheckinComment) /noprompt /override:$(AutoBuildComment) $(AssemblyQuoted)" IgnoreExitCode="true"/> </Target>

member.name: M:MAT.Server.InfopathAgent.InfopathDriver.GetNodeAttributeValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return an attribute value of a node with default removeNilAttribute = true Have you ever tried to programmatically set a value on a field only to get a schema validation error? Many times, this error is caused by the nillable attribute being present on the node. The nillable attribute is a special attribute that can appear on an xsd:element within an XML schema. If an element has the xsi:nil attribute specified, it indicates that the element is present but has no value, and therefore no content is associated with it. However, if you attempt to programmatically set a value on this node and the nillable attribute is present, you will get an error similar to: Schema validation found non-data type errors. You will find the nillable attribute is typically present on the following data types: To resolve this error, your code will simply need to test if the nil attribute is present and if so, remove that attribute before setting the value on the node. The following sample procedure takes an XpathNavigator object, checks that node for the nil attribute and if it exists deletes the attribute:
member.returns: attribute value for the first occurance

member.summary: Sets the infopath namespace.
member.remarks: namespace provides a core set of functionality for creating custom business logic in Microsoft Office InfoPath 2007 form templates. When deployed to Microsoft Office Forms Server 2007 or to an appropriately configured document library in Office SharePoint Server 2007, business logic created using this object model will run in both a Web browser and in Office InfoPath 2007. Optionally, you can write business logic that uses an additional level of functionality available from this object model that will run only in form templates opened for editing in Office InfoPath 2007.

member.name: T:MAT.BuildTasks.SmtpMail
member.summary: Build task for sending e-mails.
member.remarks: The process that runs this account is the From account and it must have the right to send e-mails.

example.code: <UsingTask TaskName="MAT.BuildTasks.SmtpMail" AssemblyFile="MAT.Core.dll" /> <SmtpMail To="$(to)" <!-- Required --> Body="$(body)" CC="$(body)" Bcc="$(body)" Subject="$(subject)" HtmlFormat="true" Attachments="$(file1);$(file2)" Server="$(server)" <

member.name: T:MAT.CommandLineParser.DefaultFileNameFromPathAttribute
member.summary: Allows the default path for a file or directory to be set. Attempt to make accurate guess about what the user would want, for example: 1. If the developer provides a default directory and file name and the user leaves this field empty, then it will use the default directory and file name 2. If the developer provides a default file name and the user provides only a directory, then it will combine the default file name with the user supplied directory 3. If the developer provides a file name and the user only provides a word, then it will extract the extension and apply it to the word to create a file name (unless the word is a file found on disk, in which case it is preserved) 4. If the developer provides a directory and the user provides a file name, then it will combine into a path 5. If the user provides a directory and a file name those will override the developer's settings

member.name: T:MAT.Security.Elevation
member.summary: Methods related to determining the elevation level of the current process.

member.name: M:MAT.Security.Elevation.IsElevated
member.summary: The possible values are: TRUE - the current process is elevated. This value indicates that either UAC is enabled, and the process was elevated by the administrator, or that UAC is disabled and the process was started by a user who is a member of the Administrators group. FALSE - the current process is not elevated (limited). This value indicates that either UAC is enabled, and the process was started normally, without the elevation, or that UAC is disabled and the process was started by a standard user.
member.returns: Bool indicating whether the current process is elevated

member.name: P:MAT.Security.Elevation.ElevationLevel
member.summary: TokenElevationTypeDefault - User is not using a "split" token. This value indicates that either UAC is disabled, or the process is started by a standard user (not a member of the Administrators group). The following two values can be returned only if both the UAC is enabled and the user is a member of the Administrator's group (that is, the user has a "split" token): TokenElevationTypeFull - the process is running elevated. TokenElevationTypeLimited - the process is not running elevated.

member.name: T:MAT.Security.ElevationType
member.summary: The TOKEN_ELEVATION_TYPE enumeration indicates the elevation type of token being queried by the GetTokenInformation function or set by the SetTokenInformation function.

member.name: F:MAT.Security.ElevationType.Default
member.summary: The token does not have a linked token.

member.name: F:MAT.Security.ElevationType.Full
member.summary: The token is an elevated token.

member.name: F:MAT.Security.ElevationType.Limited
member.summary: The token is a limited token.

member.name: T:MAT.ReliesOnAttribute
member.summary: ReliesOn Attribute is used to specificy any tests or functions in the containing class that need to be run for the current test. It will see if these tests or function have run and run them if they haven't. If any test has failed then an AssertInconclusive will be thrown.
member.remarks: TestContext.UpdateTestResults(this) must be added to the TestCleanup for the ReliesOn to maintain history of previously run tests.

member.name: T:MAT.Xml.Parser
member.summary: Parser contains a set of basic string parsing function that can be useful for quickly getting to the text in HTML or XML body without needing DOM objects.

member.name: M:MAT.Xml.Parser.GetString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query. Search help for Introduction to the Syntax of XPath
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Reads value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
string result = Parser.GetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value");
Read value for data
string result = Parser.GetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data");

member.name: M:MAT.Xml.Parser.GetString(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query. Introduction to the Syntax of XPath
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Reads value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
string result = Parser.GetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value");
Read value for data
string result = Parser.GetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data");
member.param: Decode XML information; default is true

member.name: M:MAT.Xml.Parser.SetString(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes data to the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query. Introduction to the Syntax of XPath
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Write new data to the value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
Parser.SetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value", "false");
Write a new value for data
Parser.GetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data", "New content.");
member.remarks: Make sure that & is written as &
member.param: Content to place in the node replacing existing content

member.name: M:MAT.Xml.Parser.SetString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes data to the first XML node from a file give a proper XPATH query.
member.example:
Retrieving settings from element or attribute:
Sample File:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="msnAdGroup" value="CMSIE4" /> <add key="dualSearch" value="true" /> </appSettings> <customSettings> <data>This is sample data.</data> </customSettings> </configuration>
Write new data to the value attribute for the add element whose key attribute is 'dualSearch'
Parser.SetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/appSettings/add[@key = 'dualSearch']/@value", "false");
Write a new value for data
Parser.GetString("C:\\config.xml", "//configuration/customsettings/data", "New content.");
member.remarks: Make sure that & is written as &
member.param: Content to place in the node replacing existing content
Encode XML information; default is true

member.name: T:MAT.Config
member.summary: Configuration file functions

member.name: M:MAT.Config.UpdateApplicationSettingsBaseClasses(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary:
Used to update Setting elements to correct values if run from MSTEST/QTAGENT. Uses reflection.
Searches for a .config file with the same name as the calling assembly and loads any settings sections found there into the default settings. So Properties.Settings.Default.KeyX will use the update. However new Properties.Settings() will continue to use the compiled defaults.
member.param: The calling assembly (assumes executing assembly if null)

member.name: M:MAT.Config.UpdateApplicationSettingsBaseClasses(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary:
Used to update Setting elements to correct values if run from MSTEST/QTAGENT. Uses reflection.
Searches for a .config file with the same name as the calling assembly and loads any settings sections found there into the default settings. So Properties.Settings.Default.KeyX will use the update. However new Properties.Settings() will continue to use the compiled defaults.
member.param: Config file that settings should be loaded from
The calling assembly (assumes executing assembly if null)
member.exception: Thrown if the file doesn't exist

member.name: T:SecurePasswordTextBox.SecureTextBox
member.summary: This is a TextBox implementation that uses the System.Security.SecureString as its backing store instead of standard managed string instance. At no time, is a managed string instance used to hold a component of the textual entry. It does not display any text and relies on the 'PasswordChar' character to display the amount of characters entered. If no password char is defined, then an 'asterisk' is used.

member.name: T:MAT.Security.Encryption
member.summary: This class uses a symmetric key algorithm (Rijndael/AES) to encrypt and decrypt data. As long as encryption and decryption routines use the same parameters to generate the keys, the keys are guaranteed to be the same. The class uses static functions with duplicate code to make it easier to demonstrate encryption and decryption logic. In a real-life application, this may not be the most efficient way of handling encryption, so - as soon as you feel comfortable with it - you may want to redesign this class.

member.name: T:MAT.Security.Encryption.KeySize
member.summary: Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.

member.name: T:MAT.Security.Encryption.HashAlgorithm
member.summary: Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.

member.name: M:MAT.Security.Encryption.Encrypt(System.String,System.String,System.String,MAT.Security.Encryption.HashAlgorithm,System.Int32,System.String,MAT.Security.Encryption.KeySize)
member.summary: Encrypts specified plaintext using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm and returns a base64-encoded result.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector (or IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.returns: Encrypted value formatted as a base64-encoded string.

member.name: M:MAT.Security.Encryption.Decrypt(System.String,System.String,System.String,MAT.Security.Encryption.HashAlgorithm,System.Int32,System.String,MAT.Security.Encryption.KeySize)
member.summary: Decrypts specified ciphertext using Rijndael symmetric key algorithm.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that this passphrase is an ASCII string.
Salt value used along with passphrase to generate password. Salt can be any string. In this example we assume that salt is an ASCII string.
Hash algorithm used to generate password. Allowed values are: "MD5" and "SHA1". SHA1 hashes are a bit slower, but more secure than MD5 hashes.
Number of iterations used to generate password. One or two iterations should be enough.
Initialization vector (or IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long.
Size of encryption key in bits. Allowed values are: 128, 192, and 256. Longer keys are more secure than shorter keys.
member.remarks: Most of the logic in this function is similar to the Encrypt logic. In order for decryption to work, all parameters of this function - except cipherText value - must match the corresponding parameters of the Encrypt function which was called to generate the ciphertext.

member.name: T:MAT.DialogHandler
member.summary: DialogHandler is designed for automating common dialogs by quickly adding watches for the dialogs. The most common dialog types are automatically handled Download File, Save As..., Open..., and Browse for folder.
member.remarks: FoundDialog event can also be attached to collect information about the dialog or perform other actions on the dialog.
buttonToClick can use "SENDKEYS:[keys to send] instead of button name

member.name: T:MAT.BuildTasks.MDSDeploy
member.summary: Deployment task for the MSCOM Deployment Studio

example.code:
<UsingTask TaskName="MAT.BuildTasks.MDSDeploy" AssemblyFile="MAT.Core.dll"/>
<Target Name = "AfterCompile" > <MDSDeploy ApplicationPath="MAT\Client" <!-- required --> ServiceAccount="$(ServiceAccount)" ServicePassword="$(ServicePassword)" Root="\\MXPS-TFSORCAS\CM\MSCOM" Environment="Base" Mode="Verify" LogFile="$(TestResultsFolder)\TestDeployLog.xml" Machine="127.0.0.1" Override="%(Override)" Switches="" /> OutputDeployExe='$(DropLocation)\$(BuildNumber)\Setup.exe' </MDSDeploy> </Target>

member.name: T:MAT.BuildTasks.GetDomainAccountPassword
member.summary: Build Task that can access Protected Data Store to retrieve a password for a service account (providing that the calling account has permissions to do so).
member.example:
Put this above where you're going to use this task, preferably with other UsingTask statements you already have <!-- Setup for Protected Data Store Task --> <UsingTask TaskName="MAT.BuildTasks.GetDomainAccountPassword" AssemblyFile="MAT.Core.dll" />
Put this inside your target where you want to retrieve the password: <GetDomainAccountPassword DomainAndAccountName="$(UserName)"> <Output TaskParameter="Password" PropertyName="ServicePassword"/> </GetDomainAccountPassword>
After that you can use the password by simply refering to $(ServicePassword)

member.summary: Build Task that can access Protected Data Store to retrieve a password for a service account (providing that the calling account has permissions to do so).

member.summary: Build Task that can access Protected Data Store to retrieve a password for a service account (providing that the calling account has permissions to do so).
member.returns: True if the password was able to be retrieved; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Location of Protected Data Store

member.name: P:MAT.BuildTasks.GetDomainAccountPassword.Password

member.name: M:MAT.Files.SaveResourceBytes(System.Byte[],System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the resource bytes to a file and unzips if requested.

example.code: string pathToFile = Files.SaveResourceBytes(Resources.rename, "resourcename.ext");
example.para: Extract zip file and expand to sub folder under %APPDATA%\Core
example.code: string pathToFolder = Files.SaveResourceBytes(Resources.zipName, "zipName.zip", unzipFile: true, unzipSubFolder: "SubFolder"

member.param: Name the extracted file will be saved as. If only name is supplied (no path information) then Core Common Store location will be used.
if set to true bytes are assumed to be zip file and will be unzipped.
If unzipFile is true file will unzip to this folder under the zip file location..
Compares bytes of file to resource and doesn't write to disk if files are identical.
member.returns: Location of and file name unless unzipped file and then just path to extracted files.

member.name: M:MAT.Files.RegisterAssemblyResolve(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Registers an assembly to resolve.
member.param: Name of the file in the resources to be extracted.
Name of the file with extension after extraction.

List of resolve paths that cause this file to be extracted. If null assumes same name as resourceName. Full names can be used such as "TestClassLibrary, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" or just the first name part.

member.summary: Registers an assembly to resolve.

member.name: T:MAT.Data.CsvReader
member.summary: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to Csv data.
member.remarks: Assumptions about the Csv File Format: 1. Each Csv record is seaprated by \r or \n or \r\n. 2. Csv fields are separated by a comma. 3. Leading and trailing space-characters (space and tab) adjacent to comma field separators are ignored. 4. Fields with embedded commas must be delimited with double-quote character. 5. Fields that contain double quote characters must be surrounded by double-quotes, and the embedded double-quotes must each be represented by a pair of consecutive double quotes. 6. A field that contains embedded line-breaks must be surrounded by double-quotes. 7. Fields with leading or trailing spaces must be delimited with double quote characters. 8. Fields may always be delimited with double quotes. 9. A comment line is ignored. Comment line should have a # in front. # in the middle of the line is considered a normal character.

member.name: F:MAT.Data.CsvReader._parseQuotedFields
member.summary: Whether to treat quoted fields specially

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CsvReader class with the specified TextReader. PLEASE NOTE: if you are using a network stream, you must wrap it with a BufferedStream before passing it in, or parsing will fail due to their implementation of Peek().

member.name: T:MAT.StringParser
member.summary: The StringParser class contains a set of utility functions for parsing of modifying strings specifically aimed towards HTML page results although XMLEncode is also included.

member.name: M:MAT.StringParser.GetTextBetween(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the text between two parts of a string.
member.remarks: This code GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.","sentence","short") would return " is ". Use nulls for beginning or end. This GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.", null, "sentence") would return "This ". If the start and end Delimiters are not in the source then String.Empty is returned.
member.param: left side of search; null for beginning of source
right side of search; null for end of source
member.returns: Content between start and end or String.Empty if not found.

member.name: M:MAT.StringParser.GetTextBetween(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the text between two parts of a string.
member.remarks: This code GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.","sentence","short") would return " is ". Use nulls for beginning or end. This GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.", null, "sentence") would return "This ". If the start and end Delimiters are not in the source then String.Empty is returned.
member.param: left side of search; null for beginning of source
right side of search; null for end of source
First character to start search at
member.returns: Content between start and end or String.Empty if not found.

member.name: M:MAT.StringParser.GetTextBetween(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the text between two parts of a string.
member.remarks: This code GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.","sentence","short") would return " is ". Use nulls for beginning or end. This GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.", null, "sentence") would return "This ". If the start and end Delimiters are not in the source then String.Empty is returned.
member.param: left side of search; null for beginning of source
right side of search; null for end of source
First character to start search at
(out) Index of last character of return (0 if not found)

member.name: T:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise
member.summary: Advanced class for SQL interaction

member.name: T:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.SqlConnectionOwnership
member.summary: This enum is used to indicate whether the connection was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper, so that we can set the appropriate CommandBehavior when calling ExecuteReader()

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.AttachParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of SqlParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: This method assigns dataRow column values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Object[])
member.summary: This method assigns an array of values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
Array of objects holding the values to be assigned

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.PrepareCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Boolean@)
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command
member.param: A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
true if the connection was opened by the method, otherwose is false.

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored prcedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.SqlConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare a SqlCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper
member.returns: SqlDataReader containing the results of the command

The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)

member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders");
member.param: The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.FillDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"});
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.UpdateDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the respective command for each inserted, updated, or deleted row in the DataSet.
member.remarks: e.g.: UpdateDataset(conn, insertCommand, deleteCommand, updateCommand, dataSet, "Order");
member.param: A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to insert new records into the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to delete records from the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure used to update records in the data source
The DataSet used to update the data source
The DataTable used to update the data source.

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.CreateCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Simplify the creation of a Sql command object by allowing a stored procedure and optional parameters to be provided
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlCommand command = CreateCommand(conn, "AddCustomer", "CustomerID", "CustomerName");
member.param: The name of the stored procedure
An array of string to be assigned as the source columns of the stored procedure parameters

member.name: M:MAT.Server.SqlEnterprise.ExecuteNonQueryTypedParams(System.String,System.String,System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the dataRow column values as the stored procedure's parameters values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on row values.
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The name of the stored procedure
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values.
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.summary: Determines whether user is a member of the specified security group.

member.exception: This error is thrown if the security group specified is not a security group (possibly a DL only group), or a known name (not existing)

Thrown if securityGroup is null or empty

member.name: M:Rex.RegexToSFAGeneric`1.Display(Rex.SFA{`0},System.String,Rex.RANKDIR,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: View the given SFA as a graph. Requires that dot.exe is installed. Uses dot.exe to create a file name.dot and produces a layout in name.format. If showgraph is true, starts a process to view the graph. For example if name = "foo" and format = "gif", creates a file foo.dot with the dot output and a file foo.gif as a picture. Uses the current working directory.
member.param: name of the file where the graph is stored
size of the font in node and edge labels
id true, the graph is viewed

member.summary: BDD builder for k bits using the default oder that MSB is least

member.summary: BDD builder for k bits using the default oder that MSB is least

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkOr(Rex.BDD,Rex.BDD)
member.summary: Make the BDD for a|b

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkAnd(Rex.BDD,Rex.BDD)
member.summary: Make the BDD for 'a' and 'b'

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkNot(Rex.BDD)
member.summary: Negate the BDD

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkAnd(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rex.BDD})
member.summary: Make a conjunction of all the BDDs in the enumeration

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkOr(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rex.BDD})
member.summary: Make a disjunction of all the BDDs in the enumeration

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkBddForInt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Make a BDD encoding k least significant bits of the given integer n. In this encoding MSB is considered as bit 0.

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkCharConstraint(System.Boolean,System.Char)
member.summary: Make a BDD encoding k least significant bits of the given character c. In this encoding MSB is considered as bit 0. If c is a lower case or upper case character and ignoreCase is true then add both the upper case and the lower case versions

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkBddForIntRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Make a BDD encoding k least significant bits of all the integers in the interval from m to n

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkRangeConstraint(System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Make a BDD encoding k least significant bits of all the characters in the interval from c to d. If ignoreCase is true ignore cases for upper and lower case characters by including both versions.

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkBddForIntRanges(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32[]})
member.summary: Make a BDD encoding of k least significant bits of all the integers in the ranges

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.MkRangesConstraint(System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Char[]})
member.summary: Make a BDD encoding of k least significant bits of all the characters in the character ranges. If ignoreCase is true ignore cases for upper and lower case characters by including both versions.

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.GenerateMember(Rex.Chooser,Rex.BDD)
member.summary: Generate a character that is a member of the bdd Assumes that the bdd is not BDD.False. Uses chooser to randomize member generation.

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.Serialize(Rex.BDD)
member.summary: Enumerate the bdd arcs as integer tuple [x, sourceNode, trueNode, falseNode] The root node of the BDD is the sourceNode of the first triplet. False node has id 0 and True node has id 1.

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.SerializeCompact(Rex.BDD)
member.summary: Represent the bdd as and integer array the element at index 0 is the false node the element at index 1 is the true node and entry at index i>1 is node i and has the structure (ordinal trueNode falseNode) where ordinal uses 4 bits and trueNode and falseNode each use 14 bits Assumes that the bdd has less than 2^14 nodes and at most 16 variables. BDD.False is represented by int[]{0}. BDD.True is represented by int[]{0,0}. The root of the BDD (Other than True or False) is node 2

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.Deserialize(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32[]})
member.summary: Assumes that labels in the arcs are less than k and that the arcs indeed represent a BDD. Each arc must have the form [x, sourceNode, trueNode, falseNode] with x as the bit nr. If the enumeration is empty then Bdd.True is returned. The source of the first arc is assumed to be the root node.

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.DeserializeCompact(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Recreates a BDD from an int array that has been created using SerializeCompact

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.Display(Rex.BDD,System.String,Rex.RANKDIR,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: View the given BDD as a graph. Requires that dot.exe is installed. Uses dot.exe to create a file name.dot and produces a layout in name.format. If showgraph is true, starts a process to view the graph. For example if name = "foo" and format = "gif", creates a file foo.dot with the dot output and a file foo.gif as a picture. Uses the current working directory.
member.param: name of the file where the graph is stored
size of the font in node and edge labels
id true, the graph is viewed

member.name: M:Rex.BddBuilder.ToDot(Rex.BDD,System.String,System.String,Rex.RANKDIR,System.Int32)
member.summary: Store the BDD in dot format

member.name: P:Rex.BddBuilder.NrOfBits
member.summary: Number of bits in the BDDs

member.name: T:Rex.ArgumentType
member.summary: Used to control parsing of command line arguments.

member.name: F:Rex.ArgumentType.Required
member.summary: Indicates that this field is required. An error will be displayed if it is not present when parsing arguments.

member.name: F:Rex.ArgumentType.Unique
member.summary: Only valid in conjunction with Multiple. Duplicate values will result in an error.

member.name: F:Rex.ArgumentType.Multiple
member.summary: Inidicates that the argument may be specified more than once. Only valid if the argument is a collection

member.name: F:Rex.ArgumentType.AtMostOnce
member.summary: The default type for non-collection arguments. The argument is not required, but an error will be reported if it is specified more than once.

member.name: F:Rex.ArgumentType.LastOccurenceWins
member.summary: For non-collection arguments, when the argument is specified more than once no error is reported and the value of the argument is the last value which occurs in the argument list.

member.name: F:Rex.ArgumentType.MultipleUnique
member.summary: The default type for collection arguments. The argument is permitted to occur multiple times, but duplicate values will cause an error to be reported.

member.name: F:Rex.ArgumentType.AtLeastOnce
member.summary: The default type for non-collection arguments. The argument is not required, but an error will be reported if it is specified more than once.

member.name: T:Rex.ArgumentAttribute
member.summary: Allows control of command line parsing. Attach this attribute to instance fields of types used as the destination of command line argument parsing.

member.name: M:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.#ctor(Rex.ArgumentType)
member.summary: Allows control of command line parsing.
member.param: Specifies the error checking to be done on the argument.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.Type
member.summary: The error checking to be done on the argument.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.DefaultShortName
member.summary: Returns true if the argument did not have an explicit short name specified.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.ShortName
member.summary: The short name of the argument. Set to null means use the default short name if it does not conflict with any other parameter name. Set to String.Empty for no short name. This property should not be set for DefaultArgumentAttributes.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.DefaultLongName
member.summary: Returns true if the argument did not have an explicit long name specified.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.LongName
member.summary: The long name of the argument. Set to null means use the default long name. The long name for every argument must be unique. It is an error to specify a long name of String.Empty.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default value of the argument.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.HasDefaultValue
member.summary: Returns true if the argument has a default value.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.HasHelpText
member.summary: Returns true if the argument has help text specified.

member.name: P:Rex.ArgumentAttribute.HelpText
member.summary: The help text for the argument.

member.name: T:Rex.DefaultArgumentAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that this argument is the default argument. '/' or '-' prefix only the argument value is specified. The ShortName property should not be set for DefaultArgumentAttribute instances. The LongName property is used for usage text only and does not affect the usage of the argument.

member.name: M:Rex.DefaultArgumentAttribute.#ctor(Rex.ArgumentType)
member.summary: Indicates that this argument is the default argument.
member.param: Specifies the error checking to be done on the argument.

member.name: T:Rex.ErrorReporter
member.summary: A delegate used in error reporting.

member.name: T:Rex.CommandLineParser
member.summary:
Parser for command line arguments.
The parser specification is infered from the instance fields of the object specified as the destination of the parse. Valid argument types are: int, uint, string, bool, enums Also argument types of Array of the above types are also valid.
Error checking options can be controlled by adding a ArgumentAttribute to the instance fields of the destination object.
At most one field may be marked with the DefaultArgumentAttribute indicating that arguments without a '-' or '/' prefix will be parsed as that argument.
If not specified then the parser will infer default options for parsing each instance field. The default long name of the argument is the field name. The default short name is the first character of the long name. Long names and explicitly specified short names must be unique. Default short names will be used provided that the default short name does not conflict with a long name or an explicitly specified short name.
Arguments which are array types are collection arguments. Collection arguments can be specified multiple times.

member.name: M:Rex.UnicodeCategoryRangesGenerator.Generate(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a file classname.cs in the directory path. The file contains the static class with name classname and has namespace namespacename. The class has static fields that map unicode categories to their character ranges and provide whitespace ranges. The fields are for the ASCII case (7 bits), CP437 case (8 bits) and for UTF16 (16 bits). Overwrites an existing file, even if the existing file is write protected.
member.param: path where the file is written

member.name: M:Rex.RegexToSFA`1.Display(Rex.SFA{`0},System.String,Rex.RANKDIR,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: View the given SFA as a graph. Requires that dot.exe is installed. Uses dot.exe to create a file name.dot and produces a layout in name.format. If showgraph is true, starts a process to view the graph. For example if name = "foo" and format = "gif", creates a file foo.dot with the dot output and a file foo.gif as a picture. Uses the current working directory.
member.param: name of the file where the graph is stored
size of the font in node and edge labels
id true, the graph is viewed

member.name: T:Infra.Combinatorial.CombinatorialParameter
member.summary:
Full permutation and PICT permutation generator.
Pairwise parameter permutation generator implementation is based on David Erb's idea/algorithm, (architect for the Programmer Productivity Research Center - PPRC).
PICT, which stands for Pairwise Independent Combinatorial Testing is an efficient way to design test cases. It uses a relatively small number of test cases that cover all combinations of values of any pair of parameters. This way, every two-way interaction of values is covered in at least one test case. http://winweb/pairwise/ provides links to articles about PICT and to the original tool itself.

member.name: T:Infra.Combinatorial.Combination
member.summary: Base class that includes common combination functions and structures

member.name: T:Infra.Combinatorial.Combination.ENUM_STATE
member.summary: Indicates status of enumerating possible combinations of parameters

member.name: M:Infra.Combinatorial.Combination.#ctor(Infra.Combinatorial.CombinatorialParameter[],System.String[])
member.summary: Construct a new combination with given parameters and constraints
member.param: Set of parameters in the combination

Set of expressions to constraint combinatorial generation Constraints should be C# expressions including the parameters as variables. Example: If there are CPU and RAM parameters in your combination that have the possible values "Pent, AMD" and "32,64,128,256" respectively, you can use expressions such as CPU == "Pent" , or (RAM != "64") || (CPU != "Pent") In order for the values to be treated as numbers use them without quotes. For example: RAM > 64 instead of RAM > "64"

member.summary: Determines if a metadata item exists with the given name or http-equiv

member.name: M:MAT.Web.ElementList`1.Find(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Finds first item in the list whose property exactly matches the value.
member.example: AnchorList list = new AnchorList(TestApp.Browser); Anchor noAltText = list.Find(null, "AltText");

member.name: M:MAT.Web.ElementList`1.Find(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.String)
member.summary: Find first item in the list whose string value matches the RegEx
member.example: AnchorList list = new AnchorList(TestApp.Browser); Anchor msComLink = list.Find(new RegEx("^.*(?i://www\.microsoft\.com)"), "Href");

member.name: M:MAT.Web.ElementList`1.Find(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds all items in the list whose string value matches the RegEx
member.example: AnchorList list = new AnchorList(TestApp.Browser); Anchor nonMsComLink = list.Find(new RegEx("^.*(?i://www\.microsoft\.com)"), "Href", true);

member.name: M:MAT.Web.ElementList`1.FindAll(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Finds all items in the list whose property exactly matches the value.
member.example: AnchorList list = new AnchorList(TestApp.Browser); List<Anchor> noAltText = list.FindAll(null, "AltText");

member.name: M:MAT.Web.ElementList`1.FindAll(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.String)
member.summary: Finds all items in the list whose string value matches the RegEx
member.example: AnchorList list = new AnchorList(TestApp.Browser); List<Anchor> msComLinks = list.FindAll(new RegEx("^.*(?i://www\.microsoft\.com)"), "Href");

member.name: M:MAT.Web.ElementList`1.FindAll(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds all items in the list whose string value matches the RegEx
member.example: AnchorList list = new AnchorList(TestApp.Browser); List<Anchor> nonMsComLinks = list.FindAll(new RegEx("^.*(?i://www\.microsoft\.com)"), "Href", true);

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebPage.GetElement(System.String)
member.summary:
Find the element with this text. Searching for name in the following order:
1. ID
2. Name
3. innerHTMLText
4. attribute with value = elementName
5. attribute with title = elementName
6. alt text
member.param: ID, Name, or Text to search for

Element tag to look for (not case sensitive)

Also just calling browser.GetFramesList() will display in the debug window a list of results.

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControl.GetFrameIndexHistory(mshtml.DispHTMLWindow2)
member.summary:
Returns an int[] which contains the index(es) of all parent windows, ordered from top-most down to the targeted window. For example, {1,0,0} would indicate this window is the first child window of the first child window of the second child window of the browser window.
NOTE: The index(es) returned are NOT compatible with BrowserControl.SetFrame() methods, as SetFrame() uses the "flattened" indexing system that is returned from GetFramesList()!!!!
member.param: DispHTMLWindow2 to have its parentage determined

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControl.SetFrame2(System.Object[])
member.summary: Sets the frame that all other commands will be performed against. This differs from SetFrame() in that SetFrame() will not allow interaction with subnested frames - SetFrame2() is meant to be used in conjunction with GetFramesList() - these 2 methods share the same indexing interpretation.
member.param: Name or index of the frame (for sub frames add to list)

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControl.AddDialogWatch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Some dialogs that appear in IE do not have events connected to them to allow handling. For these you need to predict the message may appear in your code then add them to the list and which button needs to be clicked when they appear. The dialogs will be added in the dialog history with the type of CustomDialog.
member.param:
Window caption to search for.
Don't include "Internet Explorer - " if it is in the name.
This is a regular expression match.

Text of the button to click. Usually "Ok", "Yes", etc...
This is case sensitive.

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControl.RemoveControlByName(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes the registry entries and all of the files associated with the specified control.
member.param: value that contains the full path to the main file (usually the .ocx file) of the control.
value that contains the class identifier (CLSID) or distribution unit name associated with the control.
value that contains the type library CLSID of the control. This can be set to NULL.

value that specifies the method used to remove the control. If set to FALSE, the removal routine first checks to see if it is safe to remove the control. If set to TRUE, the control is removed, regardless of the removal status, unless there is a sharing violation. This value only applies to the control file itself.
value that specifies if this control is part of a distribution unit. This must be set to TRUE if it is part of a distribution unit, or FALSE otherwise.
member.returns: S_OK / S_FALSE: A minor error occurred, but not serious enough to abort the operation. The control has been uninstalled successfully.

member.summary: The StringParsing class contains a set of utility functions for parsing of modifying strings specifically aimed towards HTML page results although XMLEncode is also included.

member.summary: The StringParsing class contains a set of utility functions for parsing of modifying strings specifically aimed towards HTML page results.

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.StringParsing.GetTextBetween(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the text between two parts of a string.
member.remarks: This code GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.","sentence","short") would return " is ". Use nulls for beginning or end. This GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.", null, "sentence") would return "This ". If the start and end Delimiters are not in the source then String.Empty is returned.
member.param: left side of search; null for beginning of source
right side of search; null for end of source
member.returns: Content between start and end or String.Empty if not found.

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.StringParsing.GetTextBetween(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the text between two parts of a string.
member.remarks: This code GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.","sentence","short") would return " is ". Use nulls for beginning or end. This GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.", null, "sentence") would return "This ". If the start and end Delimiters are not in the source then String.Empty is returned.
member.param: left side of search; null for beginning of source
right side of search; null for end of source
First character to start search at
member.returns: Content between start and end or String.Empty if not found.

member.name: M:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.StringParsing.GetTextBetween(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the text between two parts of a string.
member.remarks: This code GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.","sentence","short") would return " is ". Use nulls for beginning or end. This GetTextBetween("This sentence is short.", null, "sentence") would return "This ". If the start and end Delimiters are not in the source then String.Empty is returned.
member.param: left side of search; null for beginning of source
right side of search; null for end of source
First character to start search at
(out) Index of last character of return (0 if not found)

member.summary: Type of dialog that uses this event

member.name: P:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControlOpenModelessDialogEventArgs.Url
member.summary: String that specifies the URL of the document to display. If no URL is specified, a new window with about:blank is displayed.

member.name: P:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControlOpenModelessDialogEventArgs.Args
member.summary: Variant that specifies the arguments to use when displaying the document. Use this parameter to pass a value of any type, including an array of values. The dialog box can extract the values passed by the caller from the dialogArguments property of the window object. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/workshop/author/dhtml/reference/methods/open_0.asp for more info.

member.name: P:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControlOpenModelessDialogEventArgs.Features
member.summary: This String parameter is a list of items separated by commas. Each item consists of an option and a value, separated by an equals sign (for example, "fullscreen=yes, toolbar=yes"). The following features are supported. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/workshop/author/dhtml/reference/methods/open_0.asp for more info.

member.name: P:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.BrowserControlOpenModelessDialogEventArgs.ReturnValue
member.summary: Variant that returns a reference to the new window object. Use this reference to script properties and methods on the new window.

member.summary: BrowserControl of new window

member.name: T:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions
member.summary: Used to specify options for navigating to Urls.
member.remarks: Reference: MSDN

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.None
member.summary: The Url will open in the same window, with no other options.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.OpenInNewWindow
member.summary: The Url will launch in a new browser window.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.NoHistory
member.summary: The Url is not stored in the default IE history list.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.NoReadFromCache
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.NoWriteToCache
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.AllowAutoSearch
member.summary: If the browser cannot find the Url, then setting this option will set the browser to default to searching for the Url using its default search engine.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.BrowserBar
member.summary: Causes the current Explorer Bar to navigate to the given item, if possible.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.NavigateOptions.Hyperlink
member.summary: If the navigation fails when a hyperlink is being followed, this constant specifies that the resource should then be bound to the moniker using the BINDF_HYPERLINK flag.

member.name: T:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.RefreshType
member.summary: Specifies the type of refresh that is performed when a page is refreshed.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.RefreshType.Normal
member.summary: Refresh that does not include sending the HTTP "pragma:nocache" header to the server.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.RefreshType.IfExpired
member.summary: Refresh that occurs if the page has expired.

member.name: F:MAT.Web.WebBrowser.RefreshType.Completely
member.summary: Refresh that includes sending a "pragma:nocache" header to the server (HTTP URLs only).
